image.altText: Jacqui in car

props.synopsis: Jacqui Purton died after being hit by a car driven by her ex-partner at a property north-east of Hobart in March 2023. Supreme Court Justice Michael Brett described the case as "a very serious example of manslaughter".

title.children: Man who ran car over Tasmanian mum sentenced to 13 years' jail

image.altText: The University of Tasmania's lion logo on its city accommodation.

props.synopsis: Up to 13 full-time academic positions will be lost as part of the University of Tasmania's restructure of its arts and humanities courses.

title.children: University of Tasmania confirms job cuts amid humanities restructure

image.altText: Man looking away from camera wears green beanie with 'Devils' written on it

props.synopsis: Whether or not to spend many millions of dollars on a stadium in Hobart is a question being weighed by voters, with some saying they'll change who they usually vote for.

title.children: The stadium is changing how some 'rusted-on' voters will cast their ballot

image.altText: Dean Winter speaks at a lectern while Josh Willie stands beside him holding a document titled A Fresh Start Budget Repair

props.synopsis: It's been given the stamp of approval by the Tasmanian business community, the unions and the community sector â€” so what is Labor's plan for budget repair and does it stack up?

title.children: Business and unions like Tasmanian Labor's budget repair plan. So what is it?

image.altText: A man in a blue shirt talks with an older woman in grey while standing against a blue background with "tasinsure" branding.

props.synopsis: The insurance market "has failed Tasmanians", Premier Jeremy Rockliff says, as the Liberals promise to create a new state-owned insurance company. But the idea has been criticised by an economist and the Insurance Council of Australia.

title.children: Liberals promise 'cheaper, fairer' Tasmanian-owned insurance company

image.altText: A lot in a residential area with a big building on it.

props.synopsis: The northern Tasmanian city of Launceston will be home to one of the first artificial intelligence factories in Australia.

title.children: Tasmania enters the 'AI race' with factory in north of state

image.altText: Thumbnail image for Tasmania state election 2025 promise tracker article.

props.synopsis: As Tasmanians prepare for a July 19 vote, we keep track of each party's election promises on everything from health and housing to the stadium.

title.children: Hospital beds, rego cost freeze and all the other election promises

props.synopsis: Distiller Robbie Gilligan grew up in the land of whisky, a Glasgow kid, but didn't even consider a career in it until he moved to Tasmania.Â

title.children: LISTEN ðŸ”Š Distiller Robbie takes his Tassie whisky back home to Scotland

image.altText: A man with glasses and a suit and tie sits in a light green chair surrounded by books in his personal library.

props.synopsis: Independent economist Saul Eslake slams the Tasmanian Liberals' election promise of a state-owned insurance company.

title.children: LISTEN ðŸ”Š Liberal Party's TasInsure plan a 'recipe for losing money', Saul Eslake says

image.altText: A black and white image with stars

props.synopsis: Astronomers have discovered a new object that originated outside of our Solar System â€” only the third ever to be found.

title.children: New interstellar object in our Solar System moving at 'incredible speed'

image.altText: Up close of woman with blond hair and dark eyeshadow makeup.

props.synopsis: Several celebrities condemn the not guilty verdicts with Grammy-nominated singer Kesha putting her support behind the prosecution's star witness.

title.children: Celebs react to Diddy verdict with calls to 'start normalising accountability'

image.altText: GettyImages-2222612435

props.synopsis: As North Melbourne marks 100 years in the VFL/AFL, the Western Bulldogs will be intent on climbing inside the top four on the ladder as round 17 gets underway at Docklands. Follow live.

title.children: Bulldogs hoping to spoil Kangaroos' centenary celebrations

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Larkey sent down to the rooms

image.altText: An illustration of a large stadium in a green park near the CBD.

props.synopsis: A new deal has been struck between the Queensland and federal governments to fund venues â€” including a major stadium â€” for the 2032 Olympic and Paralympic Games.

title.children: Queensland and federal governments strike Olympics funding deal

image.altText: A head-and-shoulders shot of Eileen Bond dressed in black at Alan Bond's funeral.

props.synopsis: Ms Bond died last night at the age of 87 and her son remembers her as a great mother who "lived life to the fullest".

title.children: Eileen Bond, ex-wife of controversial businessman Alan Bond, dies

image.altText: Three men, Sean Combs, Justin Bieber and Rick Ross, stand together.

props.synopsis: Violence, music, money, a meteoric rise and a faster fall. Sean 'Diddy' Combs had it all until his life and crimes brought him back to the boroughs of New York City for a sordid court case.

title.children: Fame, fortune and the great escape: Inside the downward spiral of Diddy

image.altText: Hands holding a jar of pills.

props.synopsis: Australia's medicines regulator says its laws have failed to slow a growing number of people with blood toxicity attributed to a common over-the-counter vitamin.

title.children: Blood toxicity from vitamin B6 worse than originally thought, TGA admits

image.altText: Brett Button wearing a suit and tie and glasses walks in to court.

props.synopsis: Brett Andrew Button will argue in court his jail term for a crash that killed 10 people was "manifestly excessive" and the sentencing judge "erred" on two findings.

title.children: Hunter Valley bus crash driver to fight 32-year sentence

image.altText: An artist's impression of a blue whale in the sky above two people in the ocean looking up.

props.synopsis: Political criticism mounts over a WA taxpayer-funded ad campaign spruiking the state to tourists being outsourced to an east-coast production company.

title.children: Backlash over WA tourism ad campaign led by east-coast company

image.altText: Close-up picture of the red imported fire ant.

props.synopsis: The discovery of a fire ant nest at Tweed Heads on the NSW far north coast has prompted a quick response from authorities.

title.children: Authorities on alert after new fire ant nest discovered in NSW

image.altText: Britain's Catherine, Princess of Wales mid laugh during a close up interview in a beige top

props.synopsis: Catherine, the Princess of Wales, discusses her experience undergoing chemotherapy and resuming life afterwards during a visit to an English hospital.

title.children: Princess Catherine reveals more details of cancer experience during hospital visit

image.altText: Australia's Steve Smith celebrates after scoring fifty runs during the World Test Championship final

props.synopsis: Australia captain Pat Cummins confirmed Smith would replace Josh Inglis, who played two poor shots to get out in the first Test win last week, for the second match of the series in Granada.

title.children: Inglis dropped as Smith confirmed for second Test in the West Indies

image.altText: Michael Walters salutes with his right hand during a Fremantle-Melbourne AFL match.

props.synopsis: Michael Walters announces his retirement from the AFL after 239 games, with the Fremantle Dockers forward unable to overcome a persistent knee injury.

title.children: Fremantle Dockers great Michael Walters retires from AFL

image.altText: A large dam in a regional area with water spilling over a reservoir on a sunny day.

props.synopsis: Severe weather warnings have been downgraded but emergency services warn damaging winds will linger around the NSW coast today.

title.children: Warnings remain for NSW coast, Warragamba Dam spills

image.altText: A uni lecturer

props.synopsis: The Australian National University announces more staff cuts across academic and professional roles, as part of its broader goal to save $250 million by the end of the year.

title.children: Amelia's in an ANU redundancy pool with two close colleagues

image.altText: A photo of Patricia McGarry outside her home

props.synopsis: After falling behind on mortgage repayments, this home owner says she often forgoes meals to feed her cats. Recent data shows she's not alone.

title.children: Woman who finally bought her own home at age 60 faces losing it all

image.altText: Qantas Departure sign outside airport terminal

props.synopsis: Cybersecurity experts are warning Qantas customers to remain vigilant to scams and hacking attempts in coming days, after as many as 6 million Australians were caught up in a data breach. Here's what we know about the data stolen, how it could be used and what you can do to protect yourself.

title.children: What the Qantas cyber attack could mean for your personal data

image.altText: Jonathan Bailey wearing glasses kneels down to hide in long grass next to Scarlett Johansson.

props.synopsis: Journey back to the terrifying island of dinosaur mutants in Jurassic World Rebirth, starring Jonathan Bailey and Scarlett Johansson.

title.children: Jonathan Bailey's little glasses can't save Jurassic World Rebirth

image.altText: Rescuers on a boat in the water at night

props.synopsis: The KMP Tunu Pratama Jaya sank almost half an hour after leaving East Java's Ketapang port late on Wednesday, bound for Bali's Gilimanuk port, the National Search and Rescue Agency said in a statement.

title.children: Rescuers find more than 30 survivors after Bali ferry sinking leaves at least four dead

image.altText: Josh Papali'i stretches at a Maroons State of Origin training session.

props.synopsis: He has just become a father for the fourth time, but Josh Papali'i was never going to turn down an opportunity to make a State of Origin return for Queensland.

title.children: Why Papali'i answered Maroons' Origin SOS with an 'F-bomb'

image.altText: Several pistols, magazines, numerous longarms, gunbarrels, a folding knife and a mace neatly arrayed on a lineoleum floor.

props.synopsis: A Kilkivan man has been remanded in custody after a police raid on a property that allegedly led to the seizure of a large number of guns, a mace, ammunition and drug paraphernalia.

title.children: Firearms, melee weapon allegedly seized in raid on Queensland farm

image.altText: Melissa McIntosh gestures with her hand, pointing up, while holding a microphone. Behind her is a Liberal party logo.

props.synopsis: The Coalition's new shadow minister for women, Melissa McIntosh, has called for a cultural overhaul of the Liberal Party.

title.children: Shadow minister for women calls for systemic party change beyond quotas

image.altText: A close up of people wearing leather sandals on the runway

props.synopsis: At Milan Fashion Week, models strutted in Prada's new line of open-toe leather sandals. Thousands of kilometres away in India, the show was met with disbelief.

title.children: Prada accused of copying Indian fashion with new $1,200 sandals

image.altText: A woman smiles at the camera.

props.synopsis: A coastal town will host a WA tourism conference next year, but some local businesses are not sure they will still be operating due to a decline in visitors.Â

title.children: Businesses pay the price as tourists bypass WA coastal town

image.altText: Man with rainbow hair wearing rainbow clothes steps into a rainbow party bus.

props.synopsis: There have been 23 courtroom places for the public in the Erin Patterson triple-murder trial. Competition for those seats starts early each morning.Â

title.children: People turning down work shifts to spend months at the mushroom trial

image.altText: Bec Nolan with her husband and her three kids on the beach

props.synopsis: The mental load of juggling three young kids, while running a household with a husband who works long hours, and now caring for her mum with dementia, is "relentless", says Bec Nolan.

title.children: Bec is part of the 'sandwich generation'. She says it's relentless
